thread.title: WATCH: Tech defenders fight over strip-sack, Kansas recovers
thread.title_full: WATCH: Texas Tech defenders fight over strip-sack, Kansas recovers | Dallas Morning News

author: Mike DuPont
title: WATCH: Tech defenders fight over strip-sack, Kansas recovers
text:
Kansas left 10 points on the board by way of special teams in its 30-20 loss to Texas Tech, but the quirkiest play of the game may have occurred as the game wound to a close.
The Red Raiders led 23-20 in the closing minutes and freshman quarterback Ryan Willis needed to manufacture a 93-yard drive to help the Jayhawks either tie or position themselves for a win.
Following an incomplete pass, Willis was sacked by senior defensive lineman Pete Robertson and fumbled the ball into the end zone, presenting Texas Tech with an opportunity to either score a defensive touchdown or possibly record a safety. Watch below to see what happens next.
Despite not recovering the fumble, redshirt freshman and Ennis product, Jah'Shawn Johnson secured a Willis interception on the following play and went 27 yards for a touchdown to secure a 30-20 victory for Texas Tech.
